Content: Hello everyone. I was wondering if someone could point me in the right direction as far as written documentation concerning POS Staking on the KMD platform. If there are split stake thresholds, etc. I suppose a document on UTXO's, SegID's, etc. would also help in trying to explain staking on KMD.

Author: Chazmainian Devil#8874
Content: üôÇ I'm with THC. Looking for documentation to explain staking... UTXO's/SegID's and all that good stuff. KMD is very unique when it comes to POS and I want to make sure I am understanding what is going on when you get a stake reward. It can get confusing trying to explain to another member that is just starting to stake on THC.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: afaik nobody has written a guide like that yet

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/antara/antara-setup/antara-customizations.html#ac-staked

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Some notes and how does it work on the link above

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: @Chazmainian Devil

Author: Chazmainian Devil#8874
Content: Thanks @Oszy So one transparent address aka UTXO (U) has 64 SegID's (S), When you get a Stake reward it will show on block explorer which SegID was the reward winner. I think I am wrapping my head around this now.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: No not really like what you wrote.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: SegID's are on chain (THC chain has 64 segid's)

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
Your wallet, ideally, should have 64 transparent addresses, each assigned to a SegID.
One transparent address can contain thousands of different size of UTXO's, but only belong/stake on one SegID. 
AFAIK block explorer doesn't `show` segid. You can get stats with `getlastsegidstakes "blocks"`

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
Chew on the code of this, might give you an idea on what's happening behind the scenes. (how to properly manage UTXO's for staking on a Pos64 chain)

https://github.com/KMDLabs/pos64staker

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: You want to fill up all SegID's as much UTXO's as you can, with as big UTXO's as you can.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: So say you have 100K coins, you want to do 100.000 / 64 ( 1562 UTXO's on each SegID with size 1, if you want bigger UTXO's you increase size, decrease number of UTXO's)

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: if you only have 100k on segid 0 in one UTXO it will less likely stake than having that 100k split into 64. because there are 63 other segid's that can stake

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Hope this is ELI5 enough üòÑ

Author: Chazmainian Devil#8874
Content: Actually, you straightened me out by explaining the way you just did.Makes a whole lotta sense to me now. My confusion started with the wrong verbage being used IE Nodes-connections when they are actually talking about Inputs/UTXO's etc. Same thing was happening in using UTXO's and SegID's.... That clarified it 100% for me. Thanks again @Oszy

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: You're welcome. If you have more in-depth questions don't hesitate to ask in #kmdlabs

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Also, you can check your utxo staking with `getbalance64` see if your utxo's are distributed properly. If not, I highly recommend using the pos64staker tool

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: I also have very little knowledge about the THC chain itself i don't know how locking the 100k utxo (or whatever i saw last time was required?) changes things on that chain.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: It may not even apply üòÑ

Author: Chazmainian Devil#8874

Got asked a really good question today too that I could not answer regarding whether or not to transfer coins on a Staking rewards UTXO (Basically reusing that address) until he had 64 UTXO's. I've never tried doing that and would hesitate to do that TBH.

Content: pos64staker is python you can use it on windows

Content:
Hey everyone. My partner and I have a question:

I am at the step for compiling Komodo via this command ./zcutil/build-mac.sh -j8
But am getting an error: configure: error: cannot find a C99-compatible compiler
Is gcc-8 not a C99-compatible compiler?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: agama was checking chainstate after I downloaded bootstrap, but accidently also started syncing kmd

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: tried to stop kmd from syncing but just said wait for kmd to shut down while keep syncing (%went up)

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: so tried to exit agama

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: but komodod keeps running

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: killing komodod is a bad idea right?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: I have a feeling it's still checking chainstate in the background and just keeps doing that untill finished which could take a while?

Author: ùôäùôûùô£ùô†#3612
Content: Correct. Agama is waiting until the `komodod` reacts to the stop command. stopping it manually probably won't hurt your wallet.dat, but no guarantees. You may have to bootstrap again after killing it.
